description: Wandering Florence: a playlist for Duomo sunrises, cobblestone alleyways, and Renaissance evenings.

items.name: Cathedral Of Santa Maria Fiori And Piazza Duomo
Winery At Renaissance Villa
items.description: For wine lovers, the Tuscan countryside vineyards and wineries can be one of the top places to visit in Florence! Saddle up for a ride through the countryside and enjoy the scenic beauty, or get amazed by the landscape changing to scenic olive groves and vineyards. Hop off the pedal at a winery at the Renaissance villa and enjoy some delicious tasting of olive oil, wine or other Tuscan specialties. If you desire so, you may even top off the bike tour with a delicious serving of Italian gelato for more Florence sightseeing.

items.name: Cinque Terre
items.description: If you are an adventure lover, you may even try a one-day hike at Cinque Terre which is a UNESCO listed site. Experience old-world Italy while you go through the five idyllic fishing villages. You can even enjoy the glorious views of the unspoiled stretch of Italian Riviera after walking through the trails along the cliffs of this national park and soak up the atmosphere on a boat ride along the Riviera. This definitely answers your question – what to see in Florence!

items.name: 9 Santa Croce
items.description: This is another great option among the places to visit in Florence for the architecture lovers. Behind the Tuscan façade's typical geometric marble inlay, there's both a mausoleum for some of the greatest names of Florence and an art-filled church. It treasures its landmarks of the Renaissance art. You must lookout for the Cappella Bardi, Cappella Peruzzi, as well as tombs of Machiavelli, Ghiberti, Galileo, and Michelangelo.

items.name: Ponte Vecchio
items.description: One of the most widely recognized icons of the city of Florence, it is one of the best places to visit in Florence, Italy. A dazzling array of fine jewellery can be seen upon strolling through it. The Vasari Corridor or the Passageway of the Price has walls lined with priceless collections of portraits by artists like Velasquez, Michelangelo, Raphael, Leonardo da Vinci and Rembrandt, among Florence's top attractions.

items.name: Palazzo Pitti And Boboli Gardens
items.description: You can actually spend an entire day seeing the entire Pitti Palace Complex. This is one of the best places to visit in Florence with Italy's premier gardens, royal apartments, history, museums, Florentine craftsmanship, a Medici Palace, and an outstanding art gallery. The gardens climb in terraces that give a sweeping view of the city. Throughout these amazing Florence tourist attractions are fountains, an amphitheater in the quarry hole, formal beds, a maze and a faux grotto carved into the hillside

items.name: Santa Maria Novella
items.description: This Dominican church showcases the familiar striped façade of inlaid marble of Italy. This traces curving designs gracefully. It also has highlighting rows of arches in the lower floor. The artistry inside is by eminent masters like Paolo Uccello, Lippi, Domenico, Giotto, and Masaccio. Even if these are not enough, there is an entire chapel which has Andrea di Bonaiuto's frescoes lining it. Indeed, some of the best things to see in Florence!

items.name: San Miniato Al Monte
items.description: Inlaid with a façade of green and white marble, the sight of San Miniato al Monte is definitely worth the short climb beyond Florence's favourite viewpoint, the Piazzale Michelangiolo. This is the first of its kind, where the dramatic effect was put to use in Florence. Indeed one of the beautiful things to see in Florence.

items.name: Bargello Palace National Museum
items.description: Are you a history and art buff? The four masterpieces by Michelangelo are reason enough to put the Bargello Palace National Museum on your list of Florence's places to visit. And we rest our case! Do let us know after you have been to this amazing museum, how you found it!

items.name: Mercato Centrale
items.description: Well if you have started stereotyping Florence as a giant open museum, you must meet the Florentines going about their regular routines. There's definitely no better place to find them, apart from the food market at Florence. We won't complain if you plan to bring back home some souvenirs!

items.name: Mercato Nuovo
items.description: This is one of the unique marketplaces in Florence. Known as the Loggia del Porcellino, this is a building with Renaissance form of architecture. Other than souvenirs, the place is famous for its history. Once the debtors were punished here. At the center here is the ‘stone of shame', which is one important spot here. Established in the 16th century, the market sold luxury items including silk. Today, one can shop for leather items here.

items.name: Piazza Della Repubblica
items.description: Piazza Della Repubblica, the town square in Florence, is a famous place with tourists. The famous cafe here Giubbe Rosse cafe, which was opened in 1896 has been the top place frequented by writers and artists. Once the Roman forum, today the square is visited for its dainty cafes. These cafes were important places where literary people met and had great discussions. On your visit to Florence, check out some of the literary cafes here.

items.name: Basilica Di San Lorenzo
items.description: If you are looking for places to visit in Florence in 1 day then this Basilica should definitely be on your list. Located in the heart of the main market in Florence this is quite a visited attraction in the city. This 15th-century church is one of the oldest churches in Florence and is a site of attraction owing to its marvelous architecture. One can see the ecclesiastical Renaissance architecture in Basilica Di San Lorenzo, designed by Filippo Brunelleschi. The interiors flaunt totally of Renaissance neo-classical architecture. Do visit the church on your trip to Florence.

items.name: Piazza Della Signoria
items.description: An important landmark over the years for political and historical matters, the Piazza Della Signoria is a famous landmark in Florence. In front of Palazzo Vecchio, is this L shaped square which houses some major attractions. The square is really beautiful owing to the aesthetic structures that the plaza holds. Some famous sculptures here are Michelangelo's Statue of David, Hercules, the Fountain of Neptune, and more. If you are visiting Florence on a Sunday then spend some time at this plaza on a lazy Sunday evening.

items.name: Uffizi Gallery
items.description: If art interests you, then Uffizi Gallery is one place that you should not miss on your Florence tour. It is one of the most interesting places to visit in Florence, Italy. Situated in the Piazza Della Signoria, it can be covered together with the L shaped beautiful square. It is a haven for art lovers, as the gallery holds paintings dating back to the times of the Renaissance. Witness here the masterpieces by famous artists like Michelangelo, Botticelli, Leonardo da Vinci and more.
